Package net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver

Interface Summary
iReadableSelectorHandler Implements the READ stage of the four-stage system described in the gem
iRequestProcessor Implements the PROCESS stage of the four-stage system described in the gem
iResponseWriter Implements the WRITE stage of the four-stage system described in the gem (or is proxied away by a caching layer)
iSelectorHandler Implementations of this interfact have a Selector that must be created at startup.
iWebserver Represents a server that manages a set of Selector's - usually by indirecting to sub-classes.
iWritableSelectorHandler Slightly lower lever than an iResponseWriter - this is an iResponseWriter that actually writes bytes to a channel, e.g.
 

Class Summary
AcceptableSelectorHandler This class starts it's thread using the GlobalErrorLoggingThreadGroup, so it is safe to be used as a PRIMARY thread (c.f.
FileManager Note: this class is entirely composed of static methods and variables, for convenience of quickly and easily creating an example class that loads and caches files.
FourThreadWebserver Four-stage webserver, using at least one thread per stage
GatheringWritableSelectorHandler Note: do NOT use this class with JDK 1.4.2, instead use the subclass which contains a workaround for the gathering-write bugs in 1.4.2 (PlainWritableSelectorHandler)
HTTPRequest This is a simple, straightforward implementation of methods and data to represent and create HTTP requests.
HTTPResponse This is a simple, straightforward implementation of methods and data to represent and create HTTP responses.
PlainWritableSelectorHandler Exactly the same as GatheringWritableSelectorHandler, except that it doesn't use Gathering writes (because of a bug in JDK 1.4.2 which makes gathering writes VERY VERY slow with more than 20 or so buffers).
ReadableSelectorHandler Note; this class takes a single RequestProcessor object as argument to the constructor.
RequestProcessor This is a very simple example of a PROCESSing stage which merely loads a single HTML file from disk and serves it to any web-browsers that connect.
SimpleRequestCacher A very simple cache - it maintains a mapping from HTTPRequest's to the HTTPResponse that was most recently generated from each of those HTTPRequest's.
 

Exception Summary
IllegalHttpException Mainly used by HTTPRequest when it is parsing a new request - this is thrown if something happens duing the parse that indicates the HTTP protocol is being violated.
NotAcceptingRequestsException indicates that an iModule cannot accept an additional HTTPRequest onto it's incoming queue, because it is refusing additional requests.
